definitions: look fixedly at someone or something with eyes wide open for a long time
examples: Don't stare at people on public transportation
She stared at the painting in amazement

definitions: set or serve as a restriction on the size amount or extent of something
examples: We need to limit our spending this month
The school limits class sizes to twenty students

definitions: recognize the full worth or significance of someone or something
be grateful for something and express thanks for it sincerely
rise in value or price over a period of time
examples: I appreciate good music and fine art
We appreciate the complexity of this problem
I really appreciate your help with this project
She appreciates all the support from friends
Property values appreciate over time in this area
The currency has appreciated against the dollar

definitions: notice or perceive something and register it as significant
follow or fulfill a social religious or legal obligation
examples: Scientists observe changes in the environment carefully
I observed that she seemed worried
We observe all safety regulations strictly
Many people observe religious holidays

definitions: take aggressive action against a place or enemy forces with weapons
criticize or oppose fiercely and publicly with words or actions
examples: The army will attack at dawn
A wild animal might attack if threatened
The media attacked the politician's policies
Critics attacked the new proposal harshly

definitions: continue to live or exist especially in spite of danger or hardship
remain intact or in existence despite adverse conditions or passage of time
examples: She survived the accident with minor injuries
Not everyone survived the harsh winter
Only a few manuscripts survived from that era
Their friendship survived many challenges

definitions: state that something declared or believed to be true is not true
refuse to give or grant something requested or desired to someone
examples: He denied all accusations against him
I can't deny that you're right
They denied her request for time off
The bank denied his loan application

definitions: bring a fact event or situation back into one's mind from memory
officially order someone or something to return from where they are
examples: I can't recall where I left my keys
She recalled her childhood with fondness
The company recalled thousands of defective products
The ambassador was recalled to his country

definitions: repair something that is broken or not working properly
fasten something securely in a particular place or position
decide or arrange something definitely in advance
examples: Can you fix my broken computer
The plumber will fix the leak tomorrow
Fix the shelf firmly to the wall
She fixed her hair with a clip
Let's fix a date for the meeting
The price was fixed at fifty dollars

definitions: bring together or into contact so that a link is established
establish communication or a relationship between people or things
examples: Connect the two cables carefully
This bridge connects the island to mainland
I'll connect you with our sales department
We connected instantly at the party

definitions: grasp or seize suddenly and roughly with the hand
obtain or get something quickly informally or opportunistically
examples: He grabbed my arm to stop me
The child grabbed the toy eagerly
Let's grab lunch before the meeting
I grabbed the last ticket available

definitions: demand a price or payment for a service or goods provided
formally accuse someone of something especially an offense under law
rush forward in attack or move quickly and with force
examples: They charge fifty dollars per hour
The hotel charges extra for breakfast
Police charged him with theft
The prosecutor will charge her tomorrow
The bull charged at the matador
Warriors charged into battle

definitions: clearly show the existence or truth of something by evidence or example
take part in a public protest or march to show opposition
examples: The teacher demonstrated how to solve the problem
Research demonstrates the link between diet and health
Thousands demonstrated against the new law
Workers demonstrated for better conditions

definitions: be bothered annoyed or disturbed by something or someone
be careful about or pay attention to something important
examples: I don't mind waiting a few minutes
Would you mind closing the window
Mind your head on the low ceiling
Mind the gap when boarding the train

definitions: employ someone for wages to do a particular job
obtain the temporary use of something for an agreed payment
examples: We need to hire two new employees
They hired her as a consultant
Let's hire a car for the weekend
You can hire equipment from the shop

definitions: determine the size amount or degree of something using an instrument
assess the importance effect or value of something carefully
examples: Measure the room before buying furniture
The nurse measured his temperature
It's difficult to measure success
We need to measure customer satisfaction

definitions: go or extend across or to the other side of something
pass in an opposite or different direction so as to intersect
examples: Look both ways before you cross the street
We crossed the border at midnight
The two roads cross at this junction
Their paths crossed years later

definitions: resolve or reach an agreement about an argument or problem
sit or come to rest in a comfortable position
establish a permanent residence in a place
examples: They settled their differences peacefully
Let's settle this matter once and for all
The cat settled on my lap
Dust settled on the furniture
Pioneers settled in the valley
They plan to settle in Australia

definitions: control the functioning of a machine process or system
perform a surgical operation on a patient
examples: She operates heavy machinery at work
This device operates on battery power
The surgeon will operate tomorrow morning
They operated on his knee successfully

definitions: have sexual intercourse with someone using vulgar slang terminology
damage ruin or mess something up badly often used as profanity
examples: Their relationship is purely physical
This is inappropriate language for most contexts
You really fucked up this time
Don't fuck with my stuff

definitions: look at or inspect something with attention or for purpose
regard or consider someone or something in a particular way
examples: Thousands came to view the exhibition
We viewed several houses before buying
I view this as an opportunity
How do you view the situation

definitions: extend over a large area or become distributed over a period
apply a substance over a surface so as to cover it
examples: The fire spread quickly through the forest
News of their engagement spread rapidly
Spread butter on the toast evenly
She spread sunscreen on her arms

definitions: strike or propel forcibly with the foot
succeed in giving up a habit or addiction
examples: The player kicked the ball into the goal
The horse kicked the stable door
He finally kicked his smoking habit
It's hard to kick a sugar addiction

definitions: state one's intention to harm someone or something as intimidation
pose a possible source of danger or harm to something
examples: He threatened to call the police
Don't threaten me with consequences
Storm clouds threaten rain
Pollution threatens marine life

definitions: assign responsibility for a fault or wrong to someone or something
examples: Don't blame me for your mistakes
They blamed the accident on bad weather

definitions: be controlled or determined by something else as a factor
rely on someone or something for financial or emotional support
examples: Success depends on hard work and luck
The outcome depends on many factors
Children depend on their parents
We depend on this income

definitions: make certain that something will occur or be the case
examples: Please ensure all doors are locked
We must ensure everyone's safety

definitions: have a course of action as one's purpose or objective plan
examples: I intend to finish this project today
She never intended to hurt anyone

definitions: come near or nearer to someone or something in distance or time
speak to someone for the first time about something
examples: The train is approaching the station
Winter is approaching quickly
She approached him about the job
How should I approach this problem

definitions: come together or assemble in one place for a purpose
bring together and take in from scattered places or sources
examples: People gathered in the town square
Let's gather for dinner tonight
Gather all your documents before the meeting
They gather berries in summer

definitions: prepare food by mixing heating and combining ingredients in various ways
examples: She loves to cook Italian food
I'll cook dinner while you set the table

definitions: take part or become involved in an activity or event
examples: All students must participate in the discussion
She participates in many community events

definitions: put clothes on oneself or someone else
decorate or arrange something in an artistic or attractive way
examples: She dressed quickly for work
Parents dress their children warmly in winter
They dressed the window for Christmas
The chef dressed the salad beautifully

definitions: suggest someone or something as suitable for a particular purpose
advise or suggest a course of action as beneficial
examples: I recommend this restaurant highly
The doctor recommended a specialist
I recommend you arrive early
Experts recommend regular exercise

definitions: travel in or through an unfamiliar area to learn about it
examine or investigate something systematically and in detail
examples: They explored the Amazon rainforest
Children love to explore new places
Let's explore all possible options
Scientists explore the origins of life

definitions: make something longer or larger in space or time
offer or give something to someone often formally
examples: We need to extend the deadline
They extended the road by two miles
I extend my sincere apologies
The bank extended credit to them

definitions: ask someone to come to an event or go somewhere politely
make something likely to happen or encourage it unintentionally
examples: We invited them to our wedding
She invited me for coffee
Such behavior invites criticism
Leaving doors unlocked invites theft

definitions: fasten or bind with string cord or rope in a knot
connect or link things together in a relationship
examples: Tie your shoelaces before running
She tied the package with ribbon
This evidence ties him to the crime
Our families are tied by marriage

definitions: be the property of a particular person or thing
be a member of a particular group organization or class
be in the right place or situation naturally
examples: This book belongs to the library
The car belongs to my neighbor
She belongs to several professional organizations
We belong to the same club
You belong here with us
This painting belongs in a museum

definitions: get acquire or secure something especially with effort or formal procedures
examples: You need to obtain permission first
She obtained her degree last year

definitions: have as a prominent attribute or characteristic aspect
give special prominence to someone or something in publicity
examples: The phone features a new camera
This model features advanced technology
The magazine will feature her story
Tonight's show features a famous singer

definitions: resist an attack made on someone or something and protect from harm
speak or write in favor of an action or person who is criticized
examples: Soldiers defend their country bravely
She had to defend herself physically
He defended his decision to resign
Lawyers defend their clients in court

definitions: ask for something forcefully in a way that shows no refusal expected
require something as necessary according to particular conditions
examples: Workers demand better pay and conditions
She demanded to speak to the manager
This job demands total concentration
The situation demands immediate action

definitions: make an effort to achieve or complete something typically a difficult task
examples: She will attempt to break the record
They attempted to climb the mountain

definitions: raise to a higher position or level physically with effort
make someone or something happier or more cheerful emotionally
examples: Help me lift this heavy box
The crane lifted the steel beams
The good news lifted everyone's spirits
Music always lifts my mood

definitions: forgive someone for a fault or offense especially a minor one
attempt to lessen blame by providing reasons or justifications
examples: Please excuse my late arrival
Excuse me for interrupting
Don't excuse bad behavior
He excused his absence with illness

definitions: try to find something by looking or seeking carefully and thoroughly
examples: Police searched the building thoroughly
I searched everywhere for my keys

definitions: move out of or away from something and come into view
become apparent important or known gradually through development
examples: The sun emerged from behind clouds
A figure emerged from the shadows
New evidence emerged during the trial
She emerged as a leader

definitions: form an opinion or conclusion about someone or something carefully
decide a case in a court of law as an authorized official
examples: Don't judge people by appearances
I can't judge his intentions
The court will judge this case fairly
She judges competitions regularly

definitions: join or merge different things together to form a single entity
examples: Combine flour and water to make dough
Let's combine our efforts for better results
